grammarNote.title: Past Tense: た and だった
grammarNote.explanation:
The illustrations show scenes that already happened. いた is the past of いる: スニフがいた！ あった is the past of ある. だった is the past of だ: あれはスニフだった.

Past + が often signals discovery — the moment of finding out. スニフがいた！ is the shock of realization.

Re-read the chapter: which sentences describe discovery (past + が) and which describe completed states?

vocabulary.meaning: to go out, come out, appear
